In three sentences
Comments

Make sure that you are always aware of your surroundings. It is also important to not give someone opportunity, meaning that don't leave your bag unattended while you are across the hall talking to someone or leave unnecessary things in your vehicle.
I really don't know what to say about this...just always try hard.
The best advice for a student is to get involved and stay involved as this will help you build relationships and friendships that some day may help you in the long run.
Think that every student should have a study partner, as you are able to ask questions back and forth and quiz each other. This would allow you to evaluate what you truly know.

The only tradition that I can think of is that Christmas morning we all wait to open presents until the entire family is there, after that we used to go to my grandparents and have breakfast and open presents there.

Feel that if you are able to get scholarships for school that you may feel less stress in the long run. I can honestly say this is my first time in applying for scholarships and wish that had done this a very long time ago.

It is important to maintain a balance of life in all aspects. If you are unable to unwind from everything it can take a toll on you. I believe that healthy activities such as exercise, playing sports and being with friends and family is important.

It is important to make sure that you make yourself eat healthy as the extra energy that comes from eating properly is well needed. Also if you don't take care of yourself with stress of school your immune system can decline and you become more susceptible to illness.

I actually have never been a student that has stayed on campus. But I could imagine the stress that would put on a student, so make sure that you don't get yourself wrapped up in the partying aspect of being a student that stays on campus.
Make sure you are surrounded with a support system. Choose your study peers wisely. Also be sure to utilize the tools that are offered by the school such as tutoring and study aids.

When selecting a school to attend make sure it is truly what you are looking for. Research the school before you go and then have a base to go off of and visit the campus and based on the two make a decision. Think long term what is going to benefit you the most so that you are able to feel good about what you are doing. Always apply for scholarships and money that you won't have to pay back it could make a difference.

A school with outstanding opportunity that provides small classes and offers great benefits to their students. Also the technology provided for the student to work with is cutting edge and will allow a smooth transition into the field once completed. Basically an all in one institute that has top notch programs.
pageTitle: Brown Mackie College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {815082=From the only experience of enrolling this past week I feel my school is on the right road to helping people pursue there careers and interest. The administration is friendly, welcoming, and attentive to your best needs most importantly. I feel I made the right decision. Yes, I agree with the written in this post I started on the 8th of July and its been a blessings learning and utilizing the skills I learned in my first class which was Professional Development. The staff is open to helping you succeed at the same time it's up to you after administration gets your foot in the door. Success is my goal and with the help of my guidance counselor, advisor, dean, teachers # 1 I'm on the rode to my destiny and you can be too. P.S. the school utilize a program called commute smart to assist with finding others in your surrounding to car pool with. I LOVE MY SCHOOL BMC BABY......, 496695=I have just re-enrolled at Brown Mackie. I graduated in June-2012 with an associates degree in Health-care Adm. with honors, GPA- 3.62. I am enrolled again for the bachelor program here at Brown Mackie-Akron, and I am pursuing to maintain my Dean's list status., 551454=With Student advisors that you can call anytime and they will call you back that day, and are extremely friendly and helpful, I have not found another school that offers anything better. I look forward to starting in January and getting my degree quickly and easily., 1048565=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 489944=The programs provided at Brown Mackie are fast paced. The normal schedule for classes is Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday for four hours each. Classes are held from 9:00 am to 12:50 pm, 1:00 pm to 4:50 pm or from 6:00 pm to 9:50 pm. Only one class is taken per month, three classes per quarter, but the schedule allows students to work full time jobs as needed. The college is very helpful at working with students' class and employment conflicts., 547168=don't quite know yet, and tuition goes up again this December to $300+ per credit hour., 903009=To me the difficulties was the medical terms because I am Hispanic and I just learn English in 2005 but I asked for help and now my term gps of 3 months was 3.23 and overall since I started is 2.65 and I couldn't be more proud., 521702=i start on Monday October 1, 2012. my overall experiences here has been good. The people at that school treat me like how I'm suppose to be treated and they have a good support system that gives me more confidence about going to school and completing my degree., 769122=Brown-Mackie has been a great experience for me so far. I have only been enrolled since April 8, 2013 and I feel like I really do have a chance at a scholarship. If you work hard and stay focus, you can accomplish anything you set your mind to do. I am a 51 year old grandmother and I have never been so proud of myself., 2422=I am learning a lot at brown Mackie in Merrillville, IN. I was very nervous at first. I started school again in October 2010. And I was nervous because, I had been out of school for a long, so at the age of 37 years old, I felt that I would not pick up on the work quick enough, or not be able to keep up with my grades. I also, was nervous because I work a part time job, and attend school in the evening. So, I didn't think I could handle that. But, the staff at Brown Mackie Made me very comfortable, and helped me overcome this nervousness. The instructor's are thourough, and try to make sure everyone gets the understanding of what's being taught. If you don't pass your classes here, with all of the tutoring available, then this means you are not applying yourself., 82572=I have only enrolled. Will not start until July 2. At work I am on the safety committee and the fun committee., 358692=I love to fish with my daughter. Spend time with my boyfriends family. Go to VW air cooled Car shows. Fixing up a 1971 VW air cooled bus., 85376=I hopefully will start school July 2. My first impression of the staff was professional and friendly. All of the staff that I was introduced to where outgoing and personable., 82116=I have only enrolled will not start until July 2 2012. The security at the campus seem safe. You can not park with out your student badge, or enter the building., 895222=I like brown Mackie I have been going to school there since 2010., 162106=I started Brown Mackie in October. textAfterTable: I am learning alot at Brown Mackie College because of the way they organize the classes one per month, it is alot easier to focus on just that one class. Login to rate or flag the reviews Hanley from LaGrange, GA 01/20/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 3 of 280 Categories Comments Campus Safety there are two security officers that patrol the campus at all times. they are very friendly and attentive to the student's needs. although brown mackie is located in atlanta, there is hardly any crime that takes place on campus. Greek Life greek life is not offered at brown mackie college. Clubs and Activities while there are not as many clubs and activities as colleges that provide on-campus housing, there are clubs available for each major so that the students can have a head start obtaining knowledge about their future
